articles.title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
articles.description:
Most notably, the deal will likely result in CBS (owned by Paramount) and TNT/TBS (owned by Warner Bros. Discovery) being at least partially integrated.

The post What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Paramount's purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery will integrate CBS and TNT/TBS for sports broadcasts.
This integration may enhance sports viewing options for Boston residents starting in 2024.
Local fans could see improved access to major sporting events through combined streaming services.

articles.title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
articles.description:
The Patriots have been linked to Brown for quite some time, but the rumors seemed to hit their peak this week.

The post Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots express interest in A.J. Brown amid trade rumors this week.
Eagles currently demand a high asking price for Brown, hindering negotiations.
Potential trade could significantly impact Patriots' offensive strategy for the upcoming season.

articles.title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
articles.description:
State officials estimate the new toll tags will save the state $7.4 million annually.

The post Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts transitions E-ZPass from transponders to stickers starting February 2026.
State officials project annual savings of $7.4 million from the new toll tags.
Boston residents will benefit from reduced toll costs and improved efficiency.

articles.title: Video shows nearly blind refugee being released by Border Patrol, 5 days before his death
articles.description:
He was dropped off at the Tim Hortons that night after federal authorities determined he wasn't eligible for deportation.

The post Video shows nearly blind refugee being released by Border Patrol, 5 days before his death appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Border Patrol released a nearly blind refugee at Tim Hortons in Boston on February 23.
The refugee died just five days later, raising concerns about treatment of vulnerable individuals.
Local advocates call for improved support systems for refugees in Boston to prevent similar tragedies.

articles.title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
articles.description:
The janitorial business owner has pleaded not guilty to 10 tax charges, including tax evasion and filing false returns.

The post Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Woburn janitorial business owner charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax.
Owner pleaded not guilty to 10 charges, including tax evasion and false returns.
Local taxpayers may face increased scrutiny as authorities tackle tax evasion cases.
